Package com.foreach.across.modules.web.ui.elements.support

Class ContainerViewElementUtils

java.lang.Object
com.foreach.across.modules.web.ui.elements.support.ContainerViewElementUtils
public final class ContainerViewElementUtils extends Object
Contains a set of utility functions for manipulating ContainerViewElements recursively. Allows traversal of the entire tree of children in a top-down fashion, and manipulations like remove and replace.
Since:
2.0.0
Author:
Arne Vandamme

  • Method Details

    • findOrSelf

      public static Optional<ViewElement> findOrSelf(ContainerViewElement container, String elementName)
      Find the first element with the given name in the container. Will recursive through all children that are also ContainerViewElement implementations. Search will be top-down and the first matching element will be returned.
      Parameters:
      container - collection of elements
      elementName - name of the element
      Returns:
      element if found

    • find

      public static Optional<ViewElement> find(ContainerViewElement container, String elementName)
      Find the first element with the given name in the container. Will recursive through all children that are also ContainerViewElement implementations. Search will be top-down and the first matching element will be returned.
      Parameters:
      container - collection of elements
      elementName - name of the element
      Returns:
      element if found

    • findOrSelf

      public static <V extends ViewElement> Optional<V> findOrSelf(ContainerViewElement container, String elementName, Class<V> requiredType)
      Find the first element with the given name that is also of the required type. Will recursive through all children that are also ContainerViewElement implementations. Search will be top-down and the first matching element will be returned. If no element has that name or it is not of the required type, Optional.empty() will be returned.
      Parameters:
      container - collection of elements
      elementName - name of the element
      requiredType - type the element should have
      Returns:
      element if found

    • find

      public static <V extends ViewElement> Optional<V> find(ContainerViewElement container, String elementName, Class<V> requiredType)
      Find the first element with the given name that is also of the required type. Will recursive through all children that are also ContainerViewElement implementations. Search will be top-down and the first matching element will be returned. If no element has that name or it is not of the required type, Optional.empty() will be returned.
      Parameters:
      container - collection of elements
      elementName - name of the element
      requiredType - type the element should have
      Returns:
      element if found

    • flatStream

      public static Stream<ViewElement> flatStream(ContainerViewElement container)
      Creates a flattened stream of all elements in the container. Will recurse top-down through all children that are also ContainerViewElement implementations.
      Parameters:
      container - collection of elements
      Returns:
      flattened stream

    • findAll

      public static <V extends ViewElement> Stream<V> findAll(ContainerViewElement container, Class<V> requiredType)
      Find all elements in the container that are of the required type. Will recurse top-down through all children that are also ContainerViewElement implementations.
      Type Parameters:
      V - type
      Parameters:
      container - collection of elements
      requiredType - the elements should have
      Returns:
      stream of matching elements

    • findAll

      public static <V extends ViewElement> Stream<V> findAll(ContainerViewElement container, Class<V> requiredType, Predicate<V> predicate)
      Find all elements in the container that are of the required type and match the additional predicate. Will recurse top-down through all children that are also ContainerViewElement implementations.
      Type Parameters:
      V - type
      Parameters:
      container - collection of elements
      requiredType - the elements should have
      predicate - additional predicate the elements should match
      Returns:
      stream of matching elements

    • findAll

      public static Stream<ViewElement> findAll(@NonNull @NonNull ContainerViewElement container, @NonNull @NonNull Predicate<ViewElement> predicate)
      Find all elements in the container that match the predicate. Will recurse top-down through all children that are also ContainerViewElement implementations.
      Parameters:
      container - collection of elements
      predicate - additional predicate the elements should match
      Returns:
      stream of matching elements

    • findParent

      public static Optional<ContainerViewElement> findParent(ContainerViewElement container, ViewElement child)
      Find the parent ContainerViewElement of the child element. The original container will be returned if the element is a direct child.
      Parameters:
      container - collection of elements
      child - element to find the parent for
      Returns:
      container or self

    • sortRecursively

      public static void sortRecursively(ContainerViewElement container, String... elementNames)
      Recursively sorts all children of the container according to the order specified by the element names passed in. If any children are containers they will in turn be sorted.
      Parameters:
      container - whose children to sort
      elementNames - Collection of element names in order.

    • sortRecursively

      public static void sortRecursively(List<ViewElement> viewElements, String... elementNames)
      Recursively sorts the list of elements according to the order specified by the element names passed in. If any children are containers they will in turn be sorted.
      Parameters:
      viewElements - to sort
      elementNames - Collection of element names in order.

    • sort

      public static void sort(ContainerViewElement container, String... elementNames)
      Sorts the direct children of this container according to the element names passed in.
      Parameters:
      container - whose children to sort
      elementNames - Collection of element names in order.

    • sort

      public static void sort(List<ViewElement> viewElements, String... elementNames)
      Sorts the list of view elements according to the element names passed in. Named elements will be put before unnamed elements, but the original order will be kept in case of doubt.
      Parameters:
      viewElements - collection to sort
      elementNames - Collection of element names in order.

    • remove

      public static Optional<ViewElement> remove(ContainerViewElement container, String elementName)
      Remove the first element with the given name from the container or any of its children. The container will be searched top-down recursively until an element is found. The return value will be empty if no element with the given name was present.
      Parameters:
      container - to remove the element from
      elementName - name of the element to remove
      Returns:
      element that has been remove

    • removeAll

      public static Stream<ViewElement> removeAll(ContainerViewElement container, String... elementNames)
      Remove all elements with that name from the tree. The container will be searched top-down recursively for elements with that name and they will all be removed. The stream can hold fewer or more elements than the names that have been specified.

      Elements will be returned sorted according to the element names requested, and if more than one element has the same name, in tree order.

      Parameters:
      container - to remove the element from
      Returns:
      elements that have been removed

    • remove

      public static boolean remove(ContainerViewElement container, ViewElement element)
      Remove the given element from the container. Will search the container top-down recursively.
      Parameters:
      container - to remove the element from
      element - to remove
      Returns:
      true if element was present and has been removed

    • move

      public static boolean move(ContainerViewElement container, String elementToMove, String newParent)
      Attempts to move an element within the container: the element with the given name will be moved to the parent specified and remove from its current parent. True will be returned if the element has been removed from its existing parent (and thus was found and has been added to the new one).

      If the new parent already contains the element, it will not be added again, nor will its existing position in the new parent change. This does not mean however that no remove action from a different parent has happened.

      Parameters:
      container - to move the element in
      elementToMove - name of the element to move
      newParent - name of the new parent element in the container
      Returns:
      true if the element has been removed from its previous parent

    • move

      public static boolean move(ContainerViewElement container, String elementToMove, ContainerViewElement newParent)
      Attempts to move an element in the container to a new parent. The new parent does not need to be a member of the container. True will be returned if the element has been removed from its existing parent (and thus was found and has been added to the new one).

      If the new parent already contains the element, it will not be added again, nor will its existing position in the new parent change. This does not mean however that no remove action from a different parent has happened.

      Parameters:
      container - to move the element in
      elementToMove - name of the element to move
      newParent - container to add the element to
      Returns:
      true if the element has been removed from its previous parent

    • move

      public static boolean move(ContainerViewElement container, ViewElement elementToMove, String newParent)
      Attempts to move an element to a new parent that is part of the container. The actual element does not need to be a member of the container. True will be returned if the element has been removed from its existing parent (and thus was found and has been added to the new one).

      If the new parent already contains the element, it will not be added again, nor will its existing position in the new parent change. This does not mean however that no remove action from a different parent has happened.

      Parameters:
      container - to move the element in
      elementToMove - element to move
      newParent - name of the new parent element in the container
      Returns:
      true if the element has been removed from its previous parent

    • move

      public static boolean move(ContainerViewElement container, ViewElement elementToMove, ContainerViewElement newParent)
      Moves an element to a new parent container. If the element is also a member of the container, it will be removed from its current parent in the container (provided that current parent is different than the new one). True will be returned if the element has been removed from an existing parent in the container.

      If the new parent already contains the element, it will not be added again, nor will its existing position in the new parent change. This does not mean however that no remove action from a different parent has happened.

      Parameters:
      container - to move the element in
      elementToMove - element to move
      newParent - container to add the element to
      Returns:
      true if the element has been removed from its previous parent

    • replace

      public static boolean replace(ContainerViewElement container, String elementName, UnaryOperator<ViewElement> replacementFunction)
      Replace an element in the container hierarchy by another element. If the element to replace is not found nothing will happen. If the element is found, it will be passed as an argument to the replacementFunction parameter. The return value will be the replacement element. If the replacement element is null, this operation is the same as a remove(ContainerViewElement, ViewElement).
      Parameters:
      container - to replace the element in
      elementName - name of the element to replace
      replacementFunction - function that takes the original element as parameter and returns the replacement element (or null
      Returns:
      true if element was found and has been replaced (or removed)

    • replace

      public static <V extends ViewElement> boolean replace(ContainerViewElement container, String elementName, Class<V> requiredType, Function<V,? extends ViewElement> replacementFunction)
      Replace an element in the container hierarchy by another element. If the element to replace is not found or is not of the required type, nothing will happen. If the element is found, it will be passed as an argument to the replacementFunction parameter. The return value will be the replacement element. If the replacement element is null, this operation is the same as a remove(ContainerViewElement, ViewElement).
      Parameters:
      container - to replace the element in
      elementName - name of the element to replace
      requiredType - type the original element is expected to have
      replacementFunction - function that takes the original element as parameter and returns the replacement element (or null
      Returns:
      true if element was found and has been replaced (or removed)

    • replace

      public static boolean replace(ContainerViewElement container, ViewElement elementToReplace, ViewElement replacement)
      Replace an element in the container hierarchy by another element. If the element to replace is not a child of the container (or any of its children) nothing will happen. If the replacement element is null, this operation is the same as a remove(ContainerViewElement, ViewElement).
      Parameters:
      container - to replace the element in
      elementToReplace - element to replace
      replacement - new element that should be put in the same position
      Returns:
      true if element was found and has been replaced (or removed)
